description: This course examines how individuals and groups in the Middle East conceptualize and experience
politics and citizenship.  Students investigate these issues in relation to the political impact
of Western imperialism, how authoritarian states shape political possibilities, and ongoing
debates over protest movements, democratization efforts, nationalism, religion and politics,
gender relations, and refugee crises.  Counts toward Middle East studies concentration.
Prerequisite: FYW; one course in political science is recommended but not required.
fullname: Politics and Identity in the Contemporary Middle East
